extendedInfo.description: This simple app consists of a 1x1 and 2x2 homescreen widget. It will show the number of visible GPS satellites and the mean signal strength. Now you will be able to predict whether you are likely to get a location fix. Depending upon the number of satellites and signal strength you can take the decision to move around to a more open area. Remember that it takes at least 3 to 4 satellites before you can receive location fix.The new 2x2 widget will also show the number of satellites having ephemeris and almanac data in addition to accuracy. Almanac(Imprecise)  and Ephemeris(Precise) are satellite data cached in the GPS engine. The almanac data validity is in months. The ephemeris data gets invalidated in a few hours. If you get more satellites with valid ephemeris then you will quickly get location fixes with good accuracy.Operation:- Tap the widget to start it. It will run for the duration you set in the app and stop automatically. This is a battery saving measure. If you want to stop before it auto stops just tap it again. Features:-1. No of satellites2. Mean GPS signal strength(SNR)3. Two Widgets 1x1 and 2x24. No of satellites with valid Almanac5. No of satellites with valide Ephemeris6. Accuracy in metersPremium Features:-1. Color gradients2. Vibrate on Fix3. Stop on fix4. AdfreeIMPORTANT. After installation if you cant see the widget in the list of widgets just change the orientation of the device while the list of widgets is opened. This will refresh the widgets list.Note:-Permissions. The app requires internet permissions for Billing, Google ads and Analytics.Email any feedback to me.

reviews.title: Sucks now
reviews.comment: Used to be the greatest widget on my phone. After the latest update it totally sucks. GPS shuts down after a few minutes. In Navigation Mode, that means you miss turns and exits while you wait for it to get a GPS signal which never comes. Uninstalling.
reviews.author: Lawrence Ku

reviews.title: its ok, works I THINK
reviews.comment: i have JB 4.1.1 on my samsung note II, it ALWAYS says AQQUIRING....but the spicks move ALITTLE., and says 20 sats at 9.0m....so not sure, worked great on my GS3 ICS
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very nice, but wish for a 4x1 widget
reviews.comment: Very nice way to keep-alive my GPS so it stays (and avoid losing my fix) on when I turn on/off maps and navigation apps. 5 stars for that! It also uses very little resources! Please see if you can introduce a 4x1 or 3x1 widget (something that allows turning on/off GPS with one tap, and still shows some info).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not bad at all
reviews.comment: Not a bad app. I use it to lock my GPS to avoid it having to re-lock.

reviews.title: thanks, great app! and a suggestion.
reviews.comment: suggestion for an option: give a notification sound (or beep) when the gps fix is reached. maybe a dropdown menu for no beep, beep on every fix, or just the first fix after enabling the app (to avoid the constant beeping when you are in a place with a weak gps signal).

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic widget... allows me to easily keep the GPS dropping more frequent and accurate breadcrumbs in Google Latitude without having to use the Navigation app.  Would like to also have transparent backgrounds.  Also would like to be able to change more of the colors than just the background.  Keep it up good work!
